option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/Administrator/WebstormProjects/TaskTimer27":"{\"/js/timer.js\":\"`Timer`: A class that represents a timer with functionality to start, pause, and reset the timer, and display the elapsed time.\\n\\n`constructor`: Initializes the timer with a display element, and sets the initial state of the timer.\\n\\n`start`: Starts the timer and updates the display every second.\\n\\n`pause`: Pauses the timer and stops the interval.\\n\\n`reset`: Resets the timer to 0 and updates the display.\\n\\n`formatTime`: Formats the elapsed time in seconds into a string in the format \\\"HH:MM:SS\\\".\\n\\n`updateDisplay`: Updates the display element with the formatted time.\",\"/js/pomodoro.js\":\"`PomodoroTimer`: A class that extends the `Timer` class and provides a Pomodoro timer functionality, including work and break sessions, with a visual progress indicator and audio notification.\\n\\n`constructor`: Initializes the Pomodoro timer with the necessary elements and settings.\\n\\n`start`: Starts the Pomodoro timer if it\\u0027s not already running.\\n\\n`updateTimer`: Updates the timer, handles the transition between work and break sessions, and plays a notification sound when a session ends.\\n\\n`reset`: Resets the Pomodoro timer to the initial work session.\\n\\n`updateDisplay`: Updates the display elements (timer, mode, and progress) based on the current state of the Pomodoro timer.\\n\\n`updateSettings`: Updates the work and break durations of the Pomodoro timer.\",\"/style.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a task management application. It includes variables for defining the color scheme, styles for the main layout and components, and styles for the timer and task list functionality. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file. The file sets up the overall visual and interactive design of the application.\",\"/.bolt/config.json\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a JSON object that specifies a template for a project using Bolt, Vite, React, and TypeScript. The template is likely used as a starting point for a new project that utilizes these technologies.\",\"/js/theme.js\":\"This file contains a single class, `ThemeManager`, which is responsible for managing the theme of a web application.\\n\\n`ThemeManager`: A class that manages the theme of a web application, allowing the user to toggle between light and dark modes, and persisting the user\\u0027s preference in the browser\\u0027s local storage.\\n\\n`init()`: A function that initializes the theme by setting the `data-theme` attribute of the `\\u003chtml\\u003e` element and updating the theme toggle button\\u0027s icon.\\n\\n`toggle()`: A function that toggles the theme between light and dark modes, updates the `data-theme` attribute, the theme toggle button\\u0027s icon, and saves the user\\u0027s preference in the browser\\u0027s local storage.\",\"/js/taskManager.js\":\"`TaskManager`: A class that manages a list of tasks, including a stopwatch and a Pomodoro timer, and provides functionality for adding, completing, and deleting tasks, as well as toggling the timer mode and theme.\\n\\n`initializeElements`: Initializes the necessary HTML elements and validates their existence.\\n\\n`setupEventListeners`: Sets up event listeners for various user interactions, such as adding tasks, toggling the timer, and changing settings.\\n\\n`addTask`: Adds a new task to the task list and updates the UI.\\n\\n`toggleTaskComplete`: Toggles the completion status of a task and updates the UI.\\n\\n`deleteTask`: Removes a task from the task list and updates the UI.\\n\\n`toggleTimer`: Starts or pauses the current timer (stopwatch or Pomodoro).\\n\\n`resetTimer`: Resets the current timer.\\n\\n`toggleMode`: Switches between the stopwatch and Pomodoro timer modes.\\n\\n`toggleTheme`: Toggles the theme (light or dark) of the application.\\n\\n`updateTaskSelect`: Updates the task selection dropdown with the active tasks.\\n\\n`updateMainTimerDisplay`: Updates the display of the current task in the main timer.\\n\\n`renderTasks`: Renders the list of tasks in the UI.\\n\\n`saveTasks`: Saves the task list to the browser\\u0027s local storage.\\n\\n`updatePomodoroSettings`: Updates the work and break duration settings for the Pomodoro timer.\",\"/js/tasks.js\":\"This file defines a `TaskManager` class that manages a list of tasks, allowing the user to add, complete, and delete tasks, and save/load the task list to/from local storage.\\n\\n`TaskManager`: A class that manages a list of tasks, providing methods to add, complete, and delete tasks, as well as save and load the task list to/from local storage.\\n\\n`constructor`: Initializes the `TaskManager` instance, setting up event listeners and loading tasks from local storage.\\n\\n`setupEventListeners`: Sets up event listeners for the \\\"Add Task\\\" button and the task input field.\\n\\n`addTask`: Adds a new task to the task list, saves the tasks, and renders the updated task list.\\n\\n`toggleTaskComplete`: Toggles the completion status of a task, saves the tasks, and renders the updated task list.\\n\\n`deleteTask`: Removes a task from the task list, saves the tasks, and renders the updated task list.\\n\\n`formatTime`: Formats a given number of seconds into a time string in the format \\\"HH:MM:SS\\\".\\n\\n`renderTasks`: Generates the HTML for the task list and updates the task list element.\\n\\n`saveTasks`: Saves the current task list to local storage.\\n\\n`loadTasks`: Loads the task list from local storage and renders the tasks.\",\"/index.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML document that implements a task timer application. It does not contain any classes, but it does have several functions that handle the application\\u0027s functionality. Here\\u0027s a summary of the functions:\\n\\n`timer.js`:\\n- `startTimer(duration, callback)`: Starts a timer with the given duration and calls the provided callback function when the timer is finished.\\n- `formatTime(seconds)`: Formats the given number of seconds into a string in the format \\\"HH:MM:SS\\\".\\n- `updateProgressRing(progress)`: Updates the progress ring SVG element to display the current progress of the timer.\\n\\n`pomodoro.js`:\\n- `startPomodoro(workDuration, breakDuration, onComplete)`: Starts a Pomodoro timer cycle, alternating between work and break periods.\\n\\n`taskManager.js`:\\n- `addTask(taskText)`: Adds a new task to the task list.\\n- `removeTask(taskId)`: Removes a task from the task list.\\n- `selectTask(taskId)`: Selects a task from the task list for the timer.\\n\\n`script.js`:\\n- `initApp()`: Initializes the application, setting up event listeners and loading saved settings.\\n- `toggleTheme()`: Toggles the application\\u0027s theme between light and dark.\\n- `toggleSettings()`: Shows or hides the settings panel.\\n- `updateSettings()`: Updates the application\\u0027s settings based on user input.\\n\\nOverall, this file implements a task timer application that allows users to manage their tasks and time using a Pomodoro-style timer.\",\"/script.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it initializes a task manager application when the DOM is loaded, sets the initial theme based on the user\\u0027s preference stored in the local storage, and updates the theme icon accordingly.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Listens for the `DOMContentLoaded` event to initialize the task manager application.\\n2. Retrieves the user\\u0027s preferred theme from the local storage and sets the `data-theme` attribute of the `document.documentElement` accordingly.\\n3. Calls the `updateThemeIcon` function to update the theme icon based on the current theme.\\n\\nThe `updateThemeIcon` function is responsible for updating the theme icon displayed on the page based on the current theme (light or dark).\"}"}
